review: Friendly greeting at the front door....too friendly actually. The hostess said she remembered me from the prior week. Yeah well it was the same me but a different date. It took 20 minutes for our first drink to get to the table. The food got to the table before the drinks and food was ordered 10 minutes later. The waitress kept rolling her eyes and making excuses for why the drinks took so long. The first time was because there was a situation at the bar and police had to put someone in a choke hold. My date said he could see the bar from where we were seated and saw nothing. The excuse for the second round taking so long was the bar had no clean available glasses . When talking to us the waitress would lean with her elbows on the table. The manager stopped at the table to ask if everything was ok. Obviously she did this out of habit and did not really give a ish since we told her NO and complained about the slow unprofessional service and she did nada. As we were eating we were constantly asked if we were done and wanted any of our plates taken. ( I suppose she was not fibbing about the lack of clean available dinnerware cause they kept trying to get ours....lol). Unorganized .....unprofessional ....slow....you get the idea...

So yesterday 1/22/12 I (along with two others) went to the Boulevard for dinner, we were indecisive about where we wanted to dine but one of us definitely did not want to go to TGI Friday's.  I asked why not, she responded it was ghetto.  But she had never been.  I wanted to go!  We went.  We got the place and stood in line, there was one person before me and while standing in line a couple came in and stood at the podium.  When the hostess came back to the podium, she made herself comfortable (by leaning on the podium) and ask the people that came in behind me their name.  I said that I was here first.  She continued to service them...WHAT!  I gathered my party and let them know we are out.  When Ms. Ghetto is the greeter, it's time to go.  We went to Carolina Kitchen, where the service is always good.

This was the worst Friday's I've ever gone to.  First off, the server apparently lost something before we sat down and was more concerned with that than greeting us in a timely fashion and without an attitude.  We ordered Mojito's and they were disgusting.  We told the server that the drinks weren't made properly and he told us that they were made with rail rum.  We then showed him the menu which states that they are made with Bacardi.  Later we had appetizers, only 1 came out.  We weren't given any napkins or silverware.  The other appetizer never came out.  We had to ask the bartender for silverware which was dirty.  When the entree's came, we still weren't given clean silverware and had to sit and just look at our food for 5 minutes until someone tracked down our server to get us some silverware.  At the end of the meal, the missing appetizer came.  The waiter told us that the appetizer couldn't be removed from the check.  The manager was uninterested and helping us.  She never even introduced herself as the manager.  We asked the server what her name was and he said "Tee-Tee"; no one knew what her name was! This Friday's was horrible and I'm never going back!

PLEASE BE A MAN OR TAKE A MAN WITH YOU WITH YOU IF YOU WANT ANY KIND OF DECENT SERVICE AT THE BAR....BETTER YET, USE THE GAS AND DRIVE TO ANOTHER RESTAURANT!!!  Today a friend and I went there around 1:15pm. There were only 6 people at the bar when we got there (more showed up after us and received service before us). The bartender named Kionna took our drink orders and we only asked for water for the moment. Well that moment ended up lasted us another hour and a half because she NEVER came back to us. I had to yell across the bar to her to order the spinach dip. About 10 minutes later two men came into the bar and not only did she immediately start serving them, but they must have ordered the same thing and she took them their spinach dip BEFORE she brought ours and I had to point out to her that she gave them our food. Well that must have pissed her off because she blantenly ignored us for the rest of our meal. When another server came out with a second dip plate, she just pointed for the server to give it to us, but never looked at us nor said another word to us the rest of our stay. Another bartender who was very busy checking in orders and doing inventory eventually asked if we needed some help because obviously rude azz Kionna never addressed us.  So we ordered from the other bartender in which it was not her job to be serving us and watched as Kionna not only flirted with and served all the men, but served many of them before they even ordered. For example, one man walked in and was looking for an empty seat. By the time he asked me if he could sit next to me, she had already poured his beer and had it sitting there. Then the man NEVER even ordered and she knew what he wanted and put it in the system. Again she never looked our way again, but took ordered from all the men around us. I don't care if you have regulars there or not...respect all of your customers. Because the other bartender was so busy working and not flirting, we didn't get out of there until 2:53. It took us 30 just to get the check!!!! I am thoroughly disgusted with the type of service that Sabrine (the manager) allows for the staff to provide and its sad too because I'm sure she thought that she didn't get a tip because women don't give good tips. Well news flash...women don't give good tips when you don't service us like you service the men. I also want to point out that they have a different menu from the other Fridays in the area and do not have lunch portion sizes. I wish I could comment on this one drink that I saw on the menu called a Pink Punk but for the last time, KIONNA couldn't be bothered to serve us women.  UGH!!!!
It's Saturday so I guess that's why the 25 minute wait was 45 minutes. We asked two different people for honey mustard but never received it. The skinny long island was nasty.
Service was outstanding.  The meal was good.  The two for $10 is an excellent deal.

Your typical Fridays, almost certified club Fridays.  Bar/night scene is lively.  Live dj on Thursdays.  Decent service.  It can be too crowded at times, but a good outing on the boulevard and in the neighborhood.

Don't do it! Reconsider! Read some literature on this subject! K. Seriously.  Stopped in here on a gameday and ate in the dining room. Bar was packed and so was restaurant for 3 pm-ish on a Sunday. Restaurant was out of several items--drinks and food--we inquired about. Service was crazy slow (and unprofessional). Did not receive several items ordered. Food that finally came out of the kitchen was... a huge disappointment.  Best thing on the table was my kid's mandarin oranges. I don't have high expectations from Friday's, but the platter I received of mystery meats with barbecue sauce thrown on top was just nasty. Also, isn't it about time that Friday's comes up with some new promotional items? The whole 'Jack Daniels-ing' of all the food specials is feelin and TASTIN very tired. Also, weren't some people shot in this building a few years ago when it used to be Uno Pizzeria? I can't lie--I thought about that walking in with my two little girls :-/ I don't like to use the word ghetto, but, if the shoe fits... All in my party agreed--never again!

2.5 maybe, but I think rounding down is more accurate than rounding up. Redskins game at FedEx was at 4:15, but we also wanted to watch the 1:00 games, so we metroed out to Largo so we could watch the 1:00 games then walk to FedEx.  This place seemed the most likely place in the BLVD area where we could catch all the games. TVs:  The bar area had enough TVs but had the same two games on most of the TVs - Ravens game and Eagles game.  Those games of course were interesting to watch but there were many others going on and I wish we had been able to see some of those.  Most places with many TVs are trying to show all the games.  Additionally, the TV quality was crappy.  Two out of the six in our line of vision had major issues with the screen resolution.  I also didn't like how they had the volume on one of the TVs super low and blaring music that clashed with it.  They should have turned the music off and turned loud volume for one game, or turned the volume off on the TVs and left the music on. Service:  Service was very slow as our waitress was pretty inattentive.  She never came back to refill drinks, take the menus or clear the dishes and I feel like half of our time was spent looking for her.  I actually interacted with one of the managers and the busboy more than with her.  It took a while to get the managers attention as well and the food took FOREVER. Food:  I very much enjoyed the fried mozzerrella squares, though wish the portion size was bigger.  We also split a pasta dish that I thought was AWFUL.  It had some kind of balsamic vinagrette mixed with marinara type thing that didnt work at ALL.  It was also barely lukewarm when we got it. Bathrooms:  disgusting.  I actually prefer the bathrooms at the stadium to these.  There was a smell, 2/3 toilets were not flushed and there was only one tiny sink area.  When I walked in the sink faucet was on full blast but no one was in there.  What kind of person blasts the sink water and doesn't turn it off?  I wonder how long the sink had been going when I walked in. Price: the only redeeming quality of the place.  They have a lot of reasonably priced items and a great 2 for 1 deal that we took advantage of.  Its a shame that these deals are wasted on "meh" food and in a place where the service is so bad that the good prices are not worth the ordeal.

If you are expecting service you are at the wrong location.  Standing at the front waiting on the greeter is understandable.  You didn't know I was showing up for a late lunch. However, having to wait at my table for ten minutes is ridiculous.  Do not attempt to salvage the deal as they are leaving.  It is too late at that point. Disturbingly expected service for another Prince Georges County owned and operated establishment. Lets see how long they are in business. With this kind of service I give you less than a year unless you make drastic changes in your service. I work inside of a half mile and you will never see my face in your place. 0 stars is luckily for you not an option. #ZeroStars #TGIF
Stop do not go in! Service suck, food cold! Never again. People coming in promoting shows! Hot mess.

It seems so many places to eat in Largo, MD have the absolute worst service. This Friday's was better, but better isn't good either. We were sat quickly which was a plus. Our server had no idea what beers were on special and she stood there trying to guess for a few minutes as she paged through the drink menu. After going to the bar to check she came back with a response. Our appetizer and soup came out almost 20min after ordering it. It was only boneless wings and french onion soup. The food itself was good so no real complaints on that end. The server was not very attentive to the drinks and much of the staff seemed to walk back and forth talking loudly, using profanity and it just seemed very unprofessional. The manager came by our table to ask us how we were doing. Not sure what triggered this, if anything, but it was before the unprofessionalism occurred. We ordered dessert which was good so again, no complaints on the food part. I've been to better Friday's before and like so many restaurants in Largo, falls victim to poor customer service.

As much as I love Fridays, I do not go to this Fridays.  I still go out to Bowie's TGIF.  The service at this restaurant is terrible, the servers are sullen and nasty. You order and then when your order comes out.....items requested are left off.

So I came here with my coworkers after a graduation for my school & was expecting to celebrate a good school year with some great people. The service I got was so so. I was totally disappointed when I ordered my Cajun chicken & shrimp pasta and there was a piece of hair in it. The manager of course doesn't give me my food for free but he only takes 50% off & brings me out a fresh pasta. Not to mention that I couldn't use one of my coupons only because two of my co workers got some special they had and I was sitting at the same table with them which the manager says that I can not use it. That was very disappointing. Never the less I didn't enjoy myself and this was my first time going to this Fridays which I told myself I would probably never go because I always hear how bad the service is there.  I hope they pull it together and change the perception of this place because its in a great location & serves most of the African American community that's in this area.

My husband and I went for happy hour.  We sat at a bar table and he ordered a beer.  He had to send it back because it was flat.  He ordered a burger and I ordered a salad.  His burger was placed on a very obviously filthy plate and my salad came without salad dressing.  I asked the server about the dressing and she said the salad was already tossed with dressing.  At this point, we were both just disgusted with the whole experience.  I'm very surprised that the TGI Friday's corporation has allowed these things to happen and soil their brand.  I've been a loyal customer for over 20 years and I've never had a dreadful experience like this!!!!!!!
This place is nice. . Service was good S/O to our waiter. . Food was good, and I got drunk off of one patron Margarita lol. .. gotta come back again..

TERRIBLE customer service. Seriously. These people wouldn't know it if it bit them on their rear. So my husband and I come in for the 2 for 10 deal. We ask about it and the server shows it to us on the menu. I decide on the bruschetta and the petite sirloin. We order our apps, get them, eat them and wait five minutes for our server who is at another large table who apparently ordered apps, mains and desserts all at once. (Who the hell does that?) When she finally comes back, I tell her my order, and she says "We are out of it". I asked for a substitution. She asks her manager and I'm told no. So now I'm stuck with an app that's part of a combo that I'm going to have to pay extra for. I ask for the manager. She offers me something off the 2 for 15.99 combo (which is really the same, there's like 2 things different on it). I decide to do the sizzling chicken and shrimp. I ask her why she will substitute that, but not another steak that was priced 50 cents less on the menu. She didn't have a response to that. A few minutes later she comes back out and asks "Did you want the sizzling chicken or the sizzling chicken and shrimp?" "Do you want the ribs?" No, if I wanted the ribs, I WOULD HAVE ORDERED THE RIBS., At this point, we've been there for 45 minutes, and I'm done. End up paying 15 bucks for apps that were supposed to be part or a combo and one diet Coke that I got to take all of three sips of. How to fix this? First, when we ask for a special, and it's out of stock, TELL ME. Don't let me sit for all this time after I decided on what I want. I would not have ordered the 2 for 10 if I had known the steak was not available. Second, there was another steak on the menu that had a dollar list price more than the petite sirloin. Just freaking substitute it. I'm happy. They will have a repeat customer. Now I will never be back.

i like TGIF, but sometimes it overrun by kids and teenagers. it gets crowded quickly and easily so make reservations if you can. this night i was there for a friends b-day and the bartender hooked us up.
Two stars is all its. Music blasting and I think I smell marijuana in the air. I hope the head office shuts this location down. Its giving the franchise a bad name. Stay away Please.
This place has gone down hill. The switched my waitress twice. Food was ok I has better. If u feel like eating real quick at the bar u get a better service.

The worst Fridays in the area !!!!!!!!!!!!!! The only person that even kept us to stay was the server ... He kept speaking with us the whole time .... The good was horrible ... It was cold when they're rushing us out the restaurant... Employees are yelling across  the restaurant hurry up we need to go this makes no sense .. We couldn't even complain because the manager was Mia... The worst experience ...

Call in for a pick up order at 12:50 p.m.. when i get there 15 min later, waiting for help for 5 to 10 min, and nobody seem to care. After i get help, its take 30 min to get to my order to get ready and what really piss me of is spend $13.56 on the meal that is cold when i was in the car i try out the food and i was cold. Jusr wonder why its take them 50 min just to get my food. and in the end i spend all that much and  the food i get is like leftover food that i have to reheat is it worth it. If i want food like why don't i go to a near by grocery store and buy something n throw it in the microwave. Bad services, bad food. definitely not going back.

The service was horrible, we were served our appetizers with no napkins,saucer plates,or silverware.  My steak was suppose to be medium well, but yet it was like it never really hit the flame, waitress non attentative,bad service......would not recommend

This is my first Yelp review. So here we go: I would have to say that unfortunately every time I attempt to give this place a shot, the service gets incrementally worse. The staff has absolutely no concept of "service" or customer respect for that matter. I went to visit on Sunday, March 23, 2014 to get a to-go order.. When I arrived it was difficult to find the to-go station. Finally, the hostess pointed me in the right direction and that's when I went to order my food. When I arrived to the station, the server was clowning around with another customer (appeared to be an employee) attempted to collect his money for his order. After watching this transaction for almost 5 minutes, I then asked if I was in the right place to order take out. That's when the server looked at me and told yes, but she had a line, when there was only me and another woman waiting to order, and proceeded to continue here conversation with the young man she was speaking to. All the long there was another employee standing playing around and in the same conversation completely ignoring me and the woman that was waiting.  Finally, I asked for a menu and that's when she got an attitude, rolled her eyes, and attempted to give me the menu. At that point I said never mind and turned to walk out the door. In my peripheral I saw here throw the menu down and continue her conversation. Needless to say, even though that wasn't the worst service I've had there, that was my last attempt to support that location. Management: PLEASE HIRE STAFF THAT ACTUALLY CARES ABOUT YOUR BOTTOM LINE! STOP HIRING KIDS THAT COULD CARE LESS ABOUT YOUR BUSINESS AND/OR MY PATRONAGE. IF YOU MUST HIRE FOLKS THAT HAVE NO AWARENESS OF CUSTOMER SERVICE, PROVIDE ADEQUATE TRAINING AND SUPPORT TO THESE EMPLOYEES SO THEY DON'T FALL VICTIM TO MEDIOCRITY!
Took forever to get our food and it was burnt pretty bad. Not really all that great. Tables were dirty and sticky.

You know how they say first impressions are everything? Well, my first impression of this Friday's is that they are slow, crowed, and understaffed. Had to wait about an hour (was told 15 to 20) because there weren't enough servers to cover the floor. -1 The shorter of the two hostesses was a ghetto girl with her face turned up as if SHE was the one waiting too long for a table -1; The other was sweeet. When we finally sat down, it took a bit for our server to get to us but in her defense,it was pretty busy. She was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu items- +1 for her. Our food took a while but it was hot and tasty. Jasmine could have been cooked a bit longer but it was nothing a little JD's couldn't fix.+1 Lucky for us it was 3 dollar martini(they were STRONG!) and half priced apps night, so we had a ball with those. They were hot and fresh tasting. +1. Overall, I would go again at another time that isn't expected to be so busy; that wait was way too long. I may be young but I don't have time to waste like that. :P

Normally I love Fridays, so I chose this place for dinner while out of town... Big mistake. When I walked in at 5 pm.. I was seated right away but all they had was a table by the bar. This place was so busy and there were clearly a lot of people there for happy hour. My food took way too long to come to my table. My server was slow and he kept forgetting what I asked for.  I was so annoyed because while I'm starving and waiting Im also freezing because the air was blazing ..it felt like Alaska in there.. It was so bad I ended up deciding to leave before my food even came.. I asked him to just put the food in a box and I can take it home. Took him 3 trips in the back to remember the darn box :(.  I ordered spinach artichoke dip & chips as an appetizer. It was warm and delicous.. But the food I ordered was horrible. It was chicken and Cajun shrimp.. I wanted a baked potato.. But he said they don't sell them.. So. I was super disapointed .. And my food was just plain tasteless and bad... When I got to the hotel to sit down and eat I discovered the food was poorly packed in the box.. My fries were soggy and the chicken was bland and cooked too long..  This was my worst trip to a Fridays ever.

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and we really enjoyed it.  Our server was incredibly nice and the service was super quick. We ordered the appetizer that came with like three different foods (forgot the name) but it was good!!! I ordered the nachos and Michael ordered a jack Daniels burger for our entrée.  Delicious! Our server even gave me a refill without me asking. Awesome! This place rocks. We will be returning.

If your hungry, or have your kids with you do not come to this Fridays! I get the places get busy but my kids and i had to wait 20 min to be seated on a sunday and the place wasnt even busy. Once seated we waited 35 min to have anyone say a word to us. The only thing good aboit this experience was are server. She tried her best to take care of us but again if coming to this fridays in Largo bring a book,  a tablet or something...

Awful experience!!!!! My best friend and I came here today just for drinks and food. We opted to sit in the bar. The waitress was extremely rude and we waited almost 30 minutes for our food. We then asked the waitress where our food was and she said oh it's out let me bring it. Apparently it must've been ready for awhile because everything was ice cold!! We then asked to speak to a manager and she rolled her eyes and walked away. I then approached another employee and asked for a manager again same exact response. I then called from my seat and asked to speak to a manager. When I finally got him on the phone I explained I was sitting in the bar and that I was extremely upset with the situation. Long story short we left and went to Texas Roadhouse much better environment and very nice and friendly employees.

I seriously HATE this Friday's. The service is awful and forget about getting any acknowledgement. Take out is a joke. The one star was only because they have free wifi. Avoid this place by any means necessary!!

It took 10 minutes before the waiter got our drink order. Another 15 minutes actually waiting for the drinks. Soup and salad arrived, but still no appetizer. By the way, we were only given 1 set of silverware. I reckon the waiter thought I'd be okay since my bowl of soup came with a spoon, but did he expect me to wipe my mouth on my sleeve or something? Food finally arrived 50 minutes later. Still no appetizer. It's a random Tuesday night (read: not busy) but our waiter is all frazzled. I haven't eaten at a TGI Fridays in a minute so I don't know if this ineptitude is now a standard practice or if this place is just a hot mess by itself.  On a positive note, the manager (Rashid?) was very nice and the soup was hot.

Two words to describe this TGI Friday's: PURE STRUGGLE Look I use to bartend at TGI Fridays and I understand it's not one of the best companies to work for but it all depends on the management at the particular location. But this location is obviously run by Stevie J and Jos-E-Lin Hernandez because of the nonsense I witnessed at this location with the workers (I don't include customer behavior in this because it's TGI Fridays not Ruth's Steakhouse. I expect nothing from them). It took over 10 minutes to get acknowledged at the bar (Hey Slow Sally! There is a different human sitting at the bar [which isn't even busy to being with]). Then she had one hell of an attitude giving me my menu. Then I tried to get her attention three times then gave up and yelled for the gentlemen behind the bar (Maybe having a lady garden will help me this time). He was nice and took my order quickly. Then I saw some random server humping a wall (Someone should tell her Stadiums' hiring) and then another chase a customer that was her friend out while on the clock. Stevie J needs to getting better control of his bus! Anyway when the food came the wings and the Pretzel Sticks were good which almost bumped them up to 2 stars but then I got my Mozzarella sticks and they were dead fucking cold. I could tell it was a mis-order and threw it on my plate and had been sitting there for a while. Since I know all this shit is frozen (Sorry for exposing your secret TGI!) I'm just gonna go home and re-warm them the way they should.  Still love TGI Friday's but not this one. I won't be coming back to this one. I don't care if it's around the corner.

We probably had the worst waitress. We ordered drinks and food and it took forever to even get our drinks. She even brought us the wrong wings we ordered. Waitress even brought our check and we weren't even leaving yet. Im never coming here again
SLOW SERVICE! By far the worst tgif I have ever been in! I could say more but I was so hungry after this experience that I can't think straight.
This is the worst / friendliest service  I am so frustrated but the bartender makes very good drinks  I would not recommend this location

I went to this Friday's 2 nights ago and had quite possibly the worst restaurant experience I've ever had in my life. It was horrible! And I've been to this location several times before without incident (hence the 2 stars) but this night took the cake for me.  Off the bat the music was so loud that my friend and I couldn't have a normal conversation, we had to scream back and forth at each other and there was a lot of "huh? What'd you say?" happening. Were seated after about a 10 minute wait and given menus to look over. The waitress came over within about 5 minutes of us sitting down so that wasn't too bad but after that it went downhill... FAST. I ordered a mango lemonade and my friend a strawberry lemonade. We also put out orders in and I tried to order the pick 2 with spinach dip and cajun shrimp and chicken pasta but the waitress said that pasta had never been an option on the pick 2 menu at that location... LIES! I had been there about a month earlier and ordered that exact combo after going to see 50 shades of grey at the Magic Johnson Theater. I told her that and she continued to dispute with me so I let it go and got the pasta only... A little perturbed. I knew at this point that things wouldn't get any better. My friend still had hope, but I was right.  Since our drinks come from the bar I expected to wait for them for a little while but not for 20 minutes! Yes, it took that long to get our NON-alcoholic drinks. The waitress did not come back that whole time to check on us or offer an explanation. When she finally came with our drinks I asked that she just put our refills in right away so that we wouldn't be without drinks for a period of time again. She refused and said she would keep an eye on us and come back when we were almost finished to give us refills. I was baffled but didn't feel like arguing with her again. I knew, once again that was a LIE. We sipped slowly but still finished our drinks before she made it back and were once again without anything to drink for who knows how long... Maybe about 5 minutes. She finally came back, took our cups to the bar and they were REUSED... They didn't even change out the straw. Idk about you, but to me it's off putting to get a straw with lip prints on it because it could be mine but it could also not be mine. And it's not sanitary to have something that was in my mouth behind the bar where you're mixing drinks. What if the ice scoop touched my straw? That just didn't sit right with me because apparently that's a common practice here since she knew to do that. Anyway, so after being delivered 2 or 3 plates of food that we didn't order and having to constantly explain that it wasn't ours we finally got our food... My friend's burger and my pasta. Her burger looked great and she enjoyed it, my pasta however was clearly burned. It had black and brown bits all through it and big chunks of burnt bits that had been scraped up from the bottom of the pan. The shrimp was overcooked and the whole dish tasted burnt. I couldn't believe they had actually served that to me! The cook clearly didn't care enough to restart the dish after he realized he burned it and the wait staff apparently didn't notice that it didn't look right. Is there no measure of quality control? I sent it back and the waitress said she'd get me a new one. Apparently there was no urgency even tho the kitchen was due to close in 25 minutes. After 15 minutes had passed I cancelled my order and left hungry. Ended up going to Wawa. I won't be returning to this Fridays.

Upon entering the restaurant, I was greeted with "hot and fresh out the kitchen."  No, this was not a cheesy coordinated staff greeting. Instead, the restaurant had a famous singer blaring through the speakers. I was admittedly a little taken aback by the volume and type of music played, but as a fan of R&B I wasn't too bothered.  My dining companion and I were seated shortly after entering the restaurant. That is, unfortunately, where the convenience ended. The seats at which we were sitting were literally falling apart and after our initial conversation with the waitress, it was hard to get her attention despite the fact that the restaurant was almost entirely empty. When it was time to order we decided to try something different as this Friday didn't offer the specials we were accustomed to. I opted for the medium well sirloin with broccoli, mashed potatoes, and ribs. My companion got almost the exact same thing but opted for Jack Daniel-flavored ribs. (Don't judge. I got the ribs for the sole purpose of having leftovers to enjoy later.)  Now, normally restaurants seem to have a policy of delivering food and drinks to everyone at the table simultaneously. This was not the case here. For both our food and our drinks, one of us would get what was ordered a significant amount of time before the other. This was particularly strange given the fact that we ordered similar things. Anyways, onto the actual food. I took a picture of my meal in case anyone is wondering. When I got my food, I was initially disappointed. My broccoli looked like it had been around for a while and had been heated in a microwave. Nevertheless, I pushed past my disappoint to bite into my food. After battling it out with my sirloin, whose exterior was much tougher than I expected, I was rewarded with a succulent steak. It seemed well seasoned and, oddly enough, paired well with the BBQ sauce meant for the ribs. There was something about those two tastes that complimented each other and more than made up for the disappointing broccoli and mediocre mashed potatoes.  Now, of course, I just had to try the ribs out. For Yelp, course. ;) The ribs were practically falling off the bone, but paired awkwardly with the BBQ sauce. I tried some of my companion's Jack Daniel ribs and felt that it seemed like a more palatable combination.  I thought it was a decent deal for the price I paid. I just wish we didn't have to do so much waiting on our waitress and for one another to get what was ordered. Generally, I enjoy this chain restaurant, but this particular location left much to be desired in terms of customer service.

If I could give no stars I would. We got here and waited for about 5 minutes and the hostess sat us by the bar. Nobody came to greet us for 25 minutes! The waitress assigned to our table walked past us three times! Finally the hostess came back and asked if we had been greeted. We had not. She then asked us if we could write down our own order!!! I have NEVER been to a restaurant and had to write down my own order!  Our waitress walked past again and we handed her the paper as she kept walking. Mind you, she still has not greeted us! About 10 minutes later the hostess came back with the paper we wrote our order on and asked if the order was put in. Which it was not! About another 10 minutes later the bartender came to our table holding the order paper, asking us to VERIFY the order that WE wrote down!! I am ABSOLUTELY disgusted at the service, or non-service, from this Fridays. This is the last time I will EVER come here!!

I am currently in Friday's on shoppers way as we speak and I have received the worst customer service from the bartender and manager on duty.. My Server Samone is excellent however!!!!! I ordered a drink called the trashcan. When I got my drink I noticed that it looked slightly different from the last time I was here and when I tasted it there was a difference in taste, I did not taste any liquor. When I let samone know she took it back to the bar where the bartender insisted it was nothing but liquor in it. He then bought my drink back to me where he insisted there was nothing but liquor in there. After I noticed he was not gonna remake it I decided to just order another drink. Once my new drink was bought to me the MANAGER told our waitress that he was not taking the trashcan off my bill because it is not one of the drinks on the menu.. I stated to her that if the bartender would have simply remade my drink I would not have ordered another I then asked to speak with the MANAGER on duty he decided to not come to the table but instead just deduct it from the bill!!!! Over all poor customer service from both the MANAGER as well as BAR... Great service from samone!!!

All I wanted was a cheeseburger. I received the Fridays gift card for Christmas from my sister. I normally do not frequent Fridays, but again I was craving a cheeseburger and I refuse to cook today. So after several rings someone picks up and asked me to hold. After being on hold for three minutes, and in all fairness three minutes isn't really that long, but when there are so many other places I could call I'm expecting the customer service to be better than that. After reading all the terrible reviews on this Friday's location on yelp I decided to call famous Dave's! (See my four star review for famous Dave's)

Ok, three strikes you're out! First time, very very busy; my vegetarian substitute came with the Chicken anyway. Second time, called in advance; arrived 15 minutes later and was told there was a 25 minute wait. Now, today is the third and final time. We just showed up and was told they are short staffed and the wait is 35 minutes. If every time I have come and you can't do it right or have adequate staff then there is no reason for me to try again. This establishment will not be any recommendation I give when asked. I may in fact just offer the information to not go there period; asked or not.

Horrible customer service. Every time I go (I've only been twice) I'm seated within a few minutes. However it takes forever for a waiter to actually acknowledge me at the table.  After waiting too long we motioned for the waitress next to us, asking her to take our order. She stated that we weren't her table, but she would go ahead and service us. The manager (who had just taken 50% off of the tab of the table behind us because they complained about their horrible experience) asked us how our service was going. We explained our long wait time and she confirmed that the waitress that "would go ahead and service us" was actually assigned to our table all along. We were seated in her section. She didn't notice us there and tried to blame it on someone else. Perhaps she didn't notice us because she was too busy sitting on her boyfriends lap in the booth next to us... I visit a second time. It's a Thursday night so the music is so loud I have to yell to speak to people right next to me. Again, I was seated quickly but waited long for someone to take my order. Once we finally received our meals, it seemed like another 5 mins before we got forks, knives, and napkins. Just enough time for my food to start getting cold. Good customer service involves refilling cups when you see them getting low, before there is nothing but ice left. Of course this didn't happen. I finish my drink and put the cup at the edge of the table so it was in clear sight. The waiter walked past our table and didn't notice we needed refills. I get his attention, he says he'll get us refills. 5 minutes later he walks by our table again, empty handed. He completely forgot about our refills. He makes a U turn and gets us drinks.  Moral of the story is to only go to this location if you do not expect good customer service.

So I arrive at 1040pm. Seating ends at 11 according to the hostess(es). I was Advised bar area seating is open if I would like. Which means that they weren't interested in seating me right ? ... Right!  Since I was strongly "encouraged" to find my own seat.. I did! I found a booth in bar area, hostess walks by and says I can't sit here, which baffles me because I was JUST TOLD that I could sit in the bar area.  Apparently this booth in the bar area was excluded from the seating.  What she should have said "seating at the bar is open, just as an FYI booths in the bar area are NOT available"  Hostess goes to check with waiter who says he can't serve us. This was ridiculous.. So we ask for a manager. Who says we have to sit at a bar even though we are already seated.  There were Employees cursing at each other. Customers verbally assaulting each other. Very unwelcoming and not the environment I'm sure a corporately owned Fridays should present. (I assume this location is franchised in some way) As a retail manager for the past four years it would have been amazing for the manager to own the resistance of his employee, take our order and satisfy us as customers.  Managers should provide options for what can be done always. If seating ends in two mins then we should be given the option to be seated in twenty mins Suggestions for future success:  1. PLEASE turn off this blasting music that you play all time... It's way too much.  2. If seating hasn't ended for the night... Seat the guests.  3. If you're the manager please be prepared to handle escalations and not just agree with your employee in the heat of the moment.  4. Don't allow employees to "talk back" to customers when customers are speaking to Managers about the situation at hand.  I would love for a TGIFridays rep to call me to discuss my refund :-)

Not the best Fridays but definitely not the worse the bar is fairly small crowd is pretty big so it can be a bit slow due to the high demand location has a DJ once or twice a week so it's a decent spot if you have patience drinks up for the strong $4 Long Island won't be that too many places Martin bartenders are ok

Listen, I have been to some bad restaurants. This is not the top 10 worst places I have been but it is a strong 11.  Why is the music set to an ear deafening level?  It's not easy listening music either. A lot of base and drum beats so not only is it loud, but you literally feel the music shaking you. It makes NO sense. Forget trying to talk to anyone without yelling.   It took 15 mins to get seated.  When we were seated we got no silverware.  Service was slow, but that was to be expected. There were 2 large parties there and the place was busy. We were ignored at our table until one of the hostesses spotted that no one was taking our orders. The waitress came over and we ordered immediately.    When the appetizers came out, still no silverware. The manager had to bring them to us. The water tastes like tap water taken out of the Potomac river. When we got our apps, we got no app plates. The chicken wing bites were ice cold in the middle. Plus we asked for blue cheese and got ranch.   The tostado nachos were missing the beef and retried beans---so it was essentially a cracker with cheese.   The mistake came when we asked the waitress to add chicken. They substituted the beef and beans with chicken.  My cheeseburger was MIA for a half hour. When I got it, the fries were cold.  The edges of my cheeseburger were burned and bitter from the charring.  The manager visited us and said they would take off the chicken nacho app. When we got our app plates, mine was wet with what appeared to be a very small blade of grass that was black.  Stay away.  The only positive about this place is the manager. He was doing everyone else's job at Mach 10. We gave him the tip and not the waitress, who we saw 3 times (once to take our order, once to bring us the wrong app, and once when she walked right by us)

If this place weren't so close to my job, I'd never eat at this location. Every time I come here and sit at the bar, I'm ignored for at least 10 minutes. When i order food to-go, it takes forever to be prepared. When I get it, the food is cold and in a much smaller portion than if I were eating in.  The drinks aren't any good. Either too heavy handed or barely having any alcohol. The bartenders spend most of their time pandering to the repeat customer and act like you're doing them a favor by sitting at the bar. Thursday nights aren't bad. The DJ plays good music and it gets crowded pretty quickly. I prefer the Bowie location. You may have a better experience, but after 5+ visits, I know what to expect.
I was not able to get served. The hostess was not inviting, and could not give us a waiting time. Wow

I'm here all the time.. One bad experience that warrants a review. Today.. I bring my 4 year old for his birthday and I get 4 endless appetizers... We sat 39 minutes between servings and then the server "dashon" comes out and tells me "ummm.... *sucks teeth* for future reference if you come in here and order endless appetizers it might be a while"...  1. Did this guy try and tell me off??  2. Is this justification for horrible service??from now on I only come here for the bar

This is the worst TGIFs I ever been to.. I ordered  my food at 7:40pm. I did not get it until 850. I only ordered pot stickers. This is the worst !! This Friday's  will never see me or my money again!!  The drinks are not the same..I asked to speak to manager and she was accommodating! I only decided to go here because it half way point between a friend I was meeting coming from Columbia.. I will opt for Jaspers next time!!

Smells odd, customer service is among the worst I've experienced. Completely ignored by one of the bartenders and it took a while before I actually got a menu. I only came here for a quick meal before a seminar out of necessity. Will not be coming here again.

This is probably the best Friday's I've been to in a while. I loved it there!  The environment there was very welcoming and was very great. The music was great and I was grooving the whole time.  Our server was Chris. He was tall with a clean cut and mustache.  Anyways my whole table had endless Apps so that made the experience better since they are only $10.  Chris always checked up on us and made sure that my friends and I were taken care of. He's a great server and very cute as well lol.  Overall, I'll give this Friday's a perfect 10! I'll be going there again soon.

Please read and heed the 1 star ratings because they are all true. We were in on a Saturday and were finally seated as it was busy. Took drink orders and that took too much time. Our water glasses sat empty and attempts to get refills at the bar were fruitless as I was ignored. FINALLY saw the waitress who ignored the empty glasses and went past the table. Having been away for so long, it disappoints me to see people crowding this restaurant as its wait staff is very poor. People must not care.

Been waiting almost an hour for food, server is nice, but this is so slow.... We ordered a take out order at the same time as our lunch, take out came within 5 minutes and it's been over 45 for ours.... Confused.
Don't do it. Not crowded and never got my food. Waited an hour. I had to wait 20min for a draft beer.

So i came to fridays to watch the game and get a steak medium well with spinach and mashed potatoes. My food came and it was rear with broccoli i told the waiter to have the cook make it over. So while i was waiting the manager came and said can they just put it back on the grill i said no cause i had blood all on the plate she got a attitude and rolled her eyes and walked away. She was so unprofessional her name is tyressa

The service is horrible here! The servers don't come back to check on you. It took 30 minutes to get him to come back after asking other staff for him. The food is under cooked or the orders are incorrect. The shots are half the size of a normal shot. Even if you sit near the bar your service is going to be slow. I get that they play entertaining music but the frustration of trying to order isn't worth it.

I'm giving this place a one soley because the food was good. The customer service however, was not. I was out on a date with my boyfriend we ordered 1 appetizer, and 2 entrees. When we were ready to leave we asked for take out plates for our food. She said okay and came back 10 minutes later explaining how we couldnt get take out plates because the appetizer was an unlimited promotion so you cant take it home. I looked at her like she was stupid. Why would I care about the $5 app when I have a $20 plate in front of me?? So I asked the manager to come over and she gives me the same tired line. After letting her know I would be going to corporate she gave me a take out box. How petty? ?? I will never eat here again

Stopped here 2 hours after a Redskins game, only a 20 min wait which was a pleasant surprise. Nothing too noteworthy, good or bad, about the experience. The staff, however, is spread extremely thin it seems, especially servers. Our server had not one but 2 large parties and several booths, so was overwhelmed.

There's nothing special about this Fridays. I met up with a friend after a Redskins game and grabbed a seat within the bar area. I was surprised at how empty it was inside. I never got our server's name and he wasn't very prompt. I never got asked if I wanted any food just drinks. I ordered a Bombay and tonic which came out a lot of Bombay and a splash of tonic. From a drinker perspective I prefer my drinks neat with barely ice so this didn't really bother me much but from a bartending perspective the pour was had a little heavy. This probably means you get to see drunken buffoonary such as "table twerking". The service was very slow and it took about 15-20 minutes before we were able to get rung up. Service was with a smile though. Never plan on coming back here but if you like to drink...TGIF.

Beware!  Don't make the same mistake as I did.  I should of read the reviews before going to this Friday's. SMH.  I recently went to this Friday's to meet up with a friend for drinks.  I arrived first and went directly to the bar area.  I found an open table and took it.  The table must of just became available as there were several drinks still on the table from the previous guests.  No biggie.  I'll just get the server to clean the table off, except the server NEVER came.  My friend arrived 10 minutes later and still no server.  There was a crowd in the area as a playoff game was on, but nothing that would (or should) prevent receiving service.  In total we were there for about 30 minutes without seeing or being greeted by anyone.  When we did stop a hostess she did clear off the table and said our server would be with us shortly.  Again, they NEVER came.  We left after being there for over 30 minutes without any service.  I doubt I will ever come to this location again.
Rude staff. Pasta was cold in the middle. Waitress took forever to bring me a check. I barely ate because the food was so cold. They only get two stars because my 4 year old left happy
Very unprofessional establishment. Very inattentive server. Children food came out after adults with a 10 minute ordering difference and the order was wrong.

If I could give it no stars, I would. This is the reason companies are reluctant to put major restaurant chains in PG County. Each and every time I have an issue. Tonight we were quoted a 30 minute wait. I asked for a manager after I was told we still had three parties in front of is 35 minutes into the wait. I was seated about 15 minutes later. Our drink order took another 25 minutes. My father ordered a draft; it was delivered in a bottle. Although they advertised having DosXX on tap they did not. Food was horrible. Sent back chicken fingers. Cheesy chicken was horrible and chewy but I ate it because I was starving. My dad ordered jack daniel's wings... They were all flats. To make it worse. The server charged my credit card wrong 4 times. Never coming back. Portions have shrunk over the years. Quality of product is poor. Service sucks consistently, which is poor training or hiring. The sad part is this a minority owed franchise. Why can't we strive for excellence in our community rather than doing just enough to get by. This is not a restaurant, it's a bar. That's where all the attention seemed to be.

I was about to have a horrible time as I usually do when I go to this Fridays... But Sabrina the manager turned that around for me!she hand delivered my ordered to takeaway and it was ready in record timing! I was impressed.

This place sux as a happy hour spot, except on Friday when there IS NO HAPPY HOUR!!!  Recently had to wait 10 minutes to be seated, which isn't bad since they had to clean off table, but then NO ONE EVER CAME BACK and the hostess was too busy cackling with some ratchet, pink haired chick. Sooooo, we decided to seat ourselves and were promptly told that there was no self-seating, this was the quickest response to anything we experienced all night. Yeah, turn away money and return business.....BRILL-YANT!!! (I know it's spelled brilliant for you grammar majors)  So about 10 minutes passed (after 15 minutes total) when "lipstick neck" decided to stop talking to a co-worker and come take our orders. 5-8 minutes later and after a 30 minutes waist of time, we were informed that they didn't have any Jack. Oh well, Famous Dave's is right next door and they have JD and 1738 (which the bartender heated up using a mug of hot water ) Friday's at the Blvd has seen the last of your boy!  #KillYourself
Nina and Antionette are the best! Very friendly and helpful. Whenever I go there, I ask to sit in one of their sections. The other waiters are good but in my opinion they are the best!

The only reason I give this place 2-stars is because I like Friday's and this convenient location. Otherwise, this place needs a major overhaul! When you walk in, you will feel like you stepped into a time zone and you're back in high school. The hostesses are always playing  and joking around and talking more to each other than paying attention to their guests and the tables. The wait is always long even when no one is there! When we are finally seated, the food takes forever, and the waitress is always saying they have one cook. Really? You said that the last time. What is this? A game of "Flo on the Go?"  The waitresses always look exhausted, and maybe they are, which is why I tip no matter what, but they're not friendly and often times lack focus even when I've gone there during the day shortly after they open.  The food is always good and when it's busy, I do see a manager helping out which is great, but I think the professionalism is lacking, the friendliness, and the communication between staff members. For instance, our food went to the wrong table, and another occasion, we waited so long for the tab that I was tempted to walk out. The waitress was multi-tasking because they were short staffed, and everyone seemed frustrated.  From now on, I think I'm going to take the drive out Bowie or Alexandria for better service.

My husband and I stopped by after a meeting because of the new promotion they had "unlimited apps for $10-12", the hostess was very nice and gave us a table right away. We were welcomed by our waitress who seemed a little off but took our order well, my husband and i both got the endless apps swap for $12 and i also ordered a side salad. She brought out the appetizers first forgetting my side salad which pissed me off (I am a volatile pregnant mama right now and I really did not appreciate having to wait 20 mins for something so simple I was desperately craving) not to mention that the cidar glazed wings I got literally looked as if the pinche maricón cook just splashed a little bit of sauce on them, I had to keep asking the waitress where my salad was and all I got is it's coming. It DOES NOT TAKE THAT LONG TO MAKE A SALAD AND BRING IT OUT, I didn't get my salad until the SECOND APPETIZER CAME OUT WHICH TOOK FOREVER! After our first appetizer ... my husband wanted to get the new braised beef tostada next only to find out that they were out of them, that right there literally made me want to cancel our order and leave but as we had just ate obviously we could not do that and I still wanted my salad. So putting that aside my husband then decided to order the fried green beans which by our surprise the manager told us they were also out of? Only later on to have the waitress tell us they were not out of them and would get him a order right away... What kind of establishment are you trying to run? I've worked in the food business to know if you're out of stock you make plans right away to get that item, especially T.G.I. fridays because most of the pre-packaged food you get can be easily ordered and restocked within a hour. Then you give us the run around as to you may or may not have this item? Oh and waitress if you're wondering why I only tipped you $2 is because of your oblivious and careless demeanor, not bringing my salad until the next app which was a little more than 20 mins and I know that the salad was made way before, you just left it until you felt ready to bring it out. Then having my husband wait 30 mins for a refill of water, you were only serving another group of people in the next booth in front of us that you were just so chatty cathy with.  You've got to be kidding me! The place is ghetto, the staff is ghetto, and the music they play is just horrible.  Not to mention my husband had to ask our waitress numerous times to get him a water ; overall I did not enjoy the experience at this trashy restaurant and am not please with where my money went, because honestly it went down the drain.  Words of advice, if you're not familiar with a certain area or largo in general DO NOT STOP BY this place or any place in that shopping center.

Yesterday I had the extreme misfortune of going to TGI Friday's at The Boulevard (Store 2151). I was given your contact information by an uncouth woman who presented herself to be the manager on duty.  I picked up food for a friend who is ill, and what should have been a perhaps 15-minute ordeal turned into an hour and a half.  First, when I called to order, I was placed on hold. I have worked retail for quite a bit, so I understand that it can get busy. However, I was only hold for thirty minutes.  At that point, it did not make sense to hang up and call back. So I waited, and I was finally able to place my order. At that point, I waited another 20 minutes before heading over to pick the food up. I entered Friday's at 6:00 and I left at 6:41PM.  This was my first time at this location. The music was so loud I could not hear the host's directions, then when he did give me directions it was to the wrong place to pick my food up. I ended up asking a customer if she knew where I could pick up and she graciously told me.   I waited roughly 20 minutes in the To Go Area before I was helped or acknowledged by any of the four servers in that area. They were laughing, playing, dancing and singing along to the loud music while I, the customer, sat there helplessly. When a woman finally did approach me about ordering, I tried screaming to her the name of my order (again the music was louder than a club on Memorial Day) and she still did not hear me. When I finally got close enough to scream it in her ear, she gave me my total and I paid. She swiped the card, give me my receipt to sign, and a pen. She never came back. For 20 minutes. I sat there awkwardly with the growing number of people waiting to order to go.  Finally, I caught a server that passed me if there was a manager on duty. She said yes. I asked if I could speak to the manager and she said sure. Finally, about 10 minutes later I saw a Hispanic woman in gray pants, a black shirt and a headset. I deducted she was the manger based upon her  her appearance and how it differed from the servers.  I asked her if she was the manager. She said yes, never introducing herself or giving me a name. Instead she seemed hurried and tried to get away from me as if I was stopping her from going some place or bothering her. I told her I ordered well over and hour ago and I have been waiting a long time. She looked at me as if either I was an idiot, or she had no idea what I was talking about. At that point, I asked if she had a manager. Again, she looked at me if she didn't understand. Then very nastily, she told me, "well your food's here any way, you can go". No apology, no nothing. Again, I asked her if she had a manager and she basically ran to the front of the store and slapped a card in my hand. I had to scream out to her that I still had the signed receipt. She grabbed it from my hand and stormed off.  In the time that I waited, I could have been seated and ordered food to dine and probably had an appetizer or to. I waited well over an hour for a turkey burger with sweet potato fries. Never will I ever recommend this location to a friend, family member, enemy or even a homeless man on the street.  Please do something about the service and try to hire managers and servers that actually care about the customer, the product and the overall experience.

For starters I called at 7:01 to ask about a wait. I was told no wait for 3ppl. When we arrived we had to wait 20 min for a table. Once seated no one came over for about 10min. Our server Keith was actually in a different section. He came and took care of us. Very helpful and efficient. When our drinks came out the girl was ok. We had to ask for straws. The table across from us had like 10 kids. Little kids running around and bumping into ppl even the servers. Then when our appetizers came out we had no plates, we had no napkins and suddenly or server disappeared.  Not happy now. My drink was decent though.  Food finally comes out, rather quickly I should say.  But it's warm not hot. My JD chix and shrimp had not been what I expected. I hadn't ordered it in a while. Very disappointed.  Needless to say I WILL NOT BE RETURNING TO THIS LOCATION. I  say all of this with a background in the food industry. Working in the front and back of the house. We're done our food and our empty plates sat on the table for about 10min before being removed. No one even came to ask if we wanted desert. Ok were ready to leave now, wanted desert but now we're like nah. Wait where's our server? Oh here he finally is. Well my daughter wanted desert so we ordered something for her to go. Worse experience at TGI Fridays ever.

I've been by this location twice and they were pretty much the same experience. I came in during normal peak hours for dinner so I did expect some wait. I never had to wait long to be seated only if I had a preference to be be in a specific location. The music is s little loud, however I've come to learn that most Friday's try to have that younger hip appeal. Our server came over in a timely fashion and took out drink and appetizer order. Now in all honesty the bar service takes forever unless you are at the actual bar, on both occasions the person I was with had to wait 15-20 minutes for a bar drink.  Our apps did take a while, but luckily the food doesn't take much longer behind it. Working in the food service you tell the difference between a house mistake and a server mistake. Most of the issues I had were house mistakes. The staff here is young and does joke around a bit but the two separate occasions I have been here my server has been pretty decent and that's coming from a waiter at another chain restaurant. 4 for the staff  but 2 on the house...
I think every fridays in PG is a sad case. I love the pick 3 appetizer so that's why I keep coming and trying each one but service sucks! 13 mins for a glass of water? Lol

If I could give this place negative stars I would. Upon walking up to the front door the music could be heard from the parking lot. Just imagine the volume upon walking in. Then they have the audacity to have a minimum 30 minute wait. Sorry, not sorry, if I wanted to listen to loud club music I would've gone to the club, which I don't. Not my cup a tea. To Chili's I shall depart to.
Nice workers & served quickly. Music can be extremely loud even in the dinning area. Dined around 2:00pm/Wed.

A terrible experience.  First ordered appetizers. Chicken was so over cooked we couldn't eat it.  Dinner order.  My dish came out,  but  my date has been waiting 22 minutes and still no food.  We will never come back.

This time around the service by the waitress was excellent. The food was more to be desired. It was expressed to the manager and nothing was done on his part. This was the last time coming to this location. I was disappointed as always with this TGI Fridays location.

I would leave a 0 if I could. I took my family here and was seated for 10 minutes while my server was literally 3 tables away. I was not acknowledged, spoken to, and the management staff was no where to be found. Avoid this location if at all possible
This restaurant has good days and bad days. Ive noticed that coming before 7pm seems to have a happier staff. The staff after 7pm seems to be very itritated

Worst experience ever!!! Strike 1. No Yuengling on a Friday night after 6pm.  Wtf really?!? Should've left then but was already there damn near 30 mins before I found that out!!! Strike 2. Waiter says 'your food is ready but I'm waiting on hot fries so I can bring it out'  Ummm then my food isn't ready?!? Strike 3. The wait for our food and everything was OVERWHELMING!!! Over 45 minutes for burgers and ribs they had on special!! Ridiculous!! I'm outta  there and won't be back!!!
Many empty tables, still a 30 minute wait?!! Dirty bathrooms...needless to say we left after this first impression.

No one knows what they're doing here. We came for happy hour, and since it's only at the bar, and the bar was full, we sat a table. We decided to do the $10 endless appetizers, WITH ENDLESS CHOICE. But we were told by our waitress that no, you have to stick with the same item... even though all materials clearly state you have endless choice....  The waitress said, "I don't know why they word it like that, but you just choose what you want, then you stay with that. Like, you had the choice to pick whatever you wanted... that first pick." WHAT!? Maybe it's called endless choice because it's..... endless choice.... Who in their right mind would want plate after plate after plate of loaded potato skins? or the green beans? We grunted and just got a bunch of wings. We never saw a manager to discuss this with.  I've come other times and the floors are sticky and dirty. Not going back. Over this location.

Went after work for a meal. Waited 10 minutes to be seated no one in front of us. Once seated no one looked at or spoke to us for at least 20 minutes . At that point we had enough and got up and left.  Told hostess about no one waiting on us or even asking about drinks or making eye contact she did nothing and didn't seem to care. Manager was not available  to speak to us so would not waste my time.

I want to give it negative 5 stars but yelp makes you give at least give one. Upon entering this establishment we were not greeted by a friendly host face. We instead waited 10 minutes awkwardly standing at the front until we sought out a waitress to find the hostess to seat us. After finding the hostess, we waited an additional 5 minutes for her to clean a table for us to sit. We arrived at 5pm on a Monday and the place was completely empty exclusive of the bar which was packed and running like a well oiled machine. All of the tables were dirty which was confusing considering only two other tables were sat. I would love to blame this on lazy workers, however an issue of this size is more than likely a management problem. The waitress brought one drink, and it took an additional 10 minutes to receive the second, which was a warm beer.  It took another 10 minutes to even order. That makes 30-40 minutes with 1 drink, 1 warm beer and no food on a Monday at 5 in an empty restaurant. Like seriously, please get it together!  If you need more staff, hire. If you need new employees, fire the old. If you need new management, mutiny. Something! It is ridiculous that customers should have to deal with such horrid service. I'm a huge advocate for leaving and not patronizing an establishment if the service is poor. But once you've already ordered, you are kind of stuck in purgatory until the end. Even if people were watching them, which they weren't, you could accommodate one for the sole person that's asking for it, but I digress.  At this point, the two gentlemen seated next to me have ordered their drinks 4... Yes FOUR times now and received nothing.  They get up and leave.  One empathizes, but I'm no quitter..
